dt: {bc}change in pitch or loudness of the voice
{bc}the change of form that words undergo to mark such distinctions as those of case, gender, number, tense, person, mood, or voice
{bc}a form, suffix, or element involved in such variation
{bc}the act or result of curving or bending {bc}{sx|bend||}
{bc}change in curvature of an arc or curve from concave to convex or conversely

shortdef: change in pitch or loudness of the voice
the change of form that words undergo to mark such distinctions as those of case, gender, number, tense, person, mood, or voice

dt: {bc}a moment when significant change occurs or may occur {bc}{sx|turning point||}

dt.t: At 18, Bobby is at an {wi}inflection point{/wi} that will largely determine the course of his life.
… the gradual move away from big-iron machines toward work stations and personal computers has been going on for years in corporate America—but the {wi}inflection point{/wi} came suddenly.
It depends on us, on the choices we make, particularly at certain {wi}inflection points{/wi} in history; particularly when big changes are happening and everything seems up for grabs.

dt: {bc}a point on a curve that separates an arc concave upward from one concave downward and vice versa

shortdef: a moment when significant change occurs or may occur : turning point
a point on a curve that separates an arc concave upward from one concave downward and vice versa
